Course Description: THIS COURSE IS A CONTINUATION OF ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES WITH EMPHASIS ON THEORY AND CONCEPTS INVOLVING A DEEPER INSPECTION OF BALANCE SHEET AND INCOME STATEMENT TOPICS. DISCUSSIONS INCLUDE DECISIONS BY MANAGEMENT, CREDITORS, AND STOCKHOLDERS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1.  EXPLAIN THE ACCOUNTING TREATMENT FOR COMPANY TRANSACTIONS, INCLUDING YEAR-END ADJUSTMENTS, CASH, AND REVENUE RECOGNITION.
2.  RECORD AND DEMONSTRATE A TRANSACTIONS EFFECT ON COMPANY FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
3.  USE COMMON COMPUTER SOFTWARE TO CREATE FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING REPORTS.
4.  DISCUSS VARYING INTERPRETATIONS AND POSSIBLE MANIPULATIONS OF ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES AND THE   CONCEPTUAL FRAMEWORK.
5.  APPLY THE CONCEPTUAL FRAMEWORK TO ACCOUNTING SCENARIOS.
6.  APPLY TIME VALUE OF MONEY CONCEPTS TO ACCOUNTING SCENARIOS.
Textbook(s): INTERMEDIATE ACCOUNTING I, 2ND EDITION, SCHAUM’S OUTLINES 2011
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
